title: Crazed Beast
opening: The Bern royal family is a pageant of power, love, and hate. Eliwood finds himself embroiled in their troubles. He has been sent to recover the Bern family treasure: the Fire Emblem. It has been stolen from the palace vault. Relying on information that he has uncovered in the city, Hector heads south to an area filled with lakes and marshes.

intro.speaker: Sonia
intro.line: You there, open the cell.

intro.speaker: Black Fang
intro.line: Lady Sonia? Bu-But… the prisoner… My orders are that none may see him.

intro.speaker: Sonia
intro.line: Open the cell. …Did you hear me?

intro.speaker: Black Fang
intro.line: Yes… Yes!

intro.speaker: Pascal
intro.line: Oho… Aren’t you a lovely one? I pray you’ll forgive the cramped quarters.

intro.speaker: Sonia
intro.line: Pascal Grentzer, once and former count of Bern’s Landskron. A man whose battlefield prowess was feared far and wide… Until you invited your citizens to your castle and slaughtered them. Stripped of your title, you fled the king and joined the Black Fang. Is that an accurate summary?

intro.speaker: Pascal
intro.line: Hmmm… You know me well, it would seem.

intro.speaker: Sonia
intro.line: You were even made one of the Four Fangs. Spending the rest of your days in this place seems so wasteful. I’ve heard that Brendan calls you “the Beast.” A monster who would massacre an entire village to kill one person.

intro.speaker: Pascal
intro.line: He doesn’t know how to enjoy his work. “Never harm any innocents.” Bah. “The Black Fang brings justice to those above the law.” Ha ha ha… Quite droll jokes, don’t you think?

intro.speaker: Sonia
intro.line: I’m going to release you, Count. I’ve a job for you. Something you’ll love. What do you say? Are you interested?

intro.speaker: Pascal
intro.line: Hmmm… Why not? It can’t be worse than rotting here. And I must say, I do love my work… Now, tell me. What is the name of my target?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: This is a really remote area, isn’t it?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Yeah. Few people call this area home.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Hector, are you sure about this? Is the Fire Emblem really here?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Yes, I paid a small ransom for this information. There’s no mistake. Look! Do you see those three run-down fortresses? I was told the thieves who base themselves there stole the Emblem.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Thieves. Wonder if it’s true.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: We’ll simply have to go and confirm it for ourselves.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Come on. Let’s go!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Oh! Wait, you two! This looks… It’s them!

intro.speaker: Pascal
intro.line: It’s about time. Shall we get started?

intro.speaker: Black Fang
intro.line: Lo…Lord Pascal, are you sure? Shouldn’t we tell the chief we’ve found them?

intro.speaker: Pascal
intro.line: You don’t understand, do you? If we tell anyone, the Four Fangs will take over. I will not let my prey be snatched away by those spoiled children.

intro.speaker: Black Fang
intro.line: But… But…

intro.speaker: Pascal
intro.line: If you wish to be executed for desertion, I’ll not stop you from fleeing. I think it would be more fun to fight though, don’t you? Shall we proceed, gentlemen?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: …Looks like we’re completely surrounded.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Bah, I don’t think we’ll lose if we fight, but… These are not the most favorable conditions. OK! I don’t care who, but someone needs to break out and seize those fortresses. Got that!? We seize all three of them!

battle.speaker: Fiora
battle.line: We’re moving out, too, right, Mark? Let’s go, Florina.

battle.speaker: Florina
battle.line: OK… But there are so many of them. If only Farina were here with us…

battle.speaker: Fiora
battle.line: Florina, it’s not helping us to talk about her now. Now, Mark. Give us our orders.

battle.speaker: Farina
battle.line: Wow! It’s started! I must negotiate quickly, or all the fighting will be done! Who looks to be in charge on this side? Aha! There! That must be the leader!

boss.speaker: Pascal
boss.line: I am Count Pascal Grentzer of Landskron... The man who will cut short your miserable lives.

boss.speaker: Pascal
boss.line: Gahaa... Urrg...gaa... Is this...death? Is this...what I have... wrought so oft before?

visit.speaker: Karla
visit.line: Hmmm… I heard there was a fighter whose swordwork was a terror to behold. I traveled a long way to see him myself, but it wasn’t my brother. My brother’s strokes are far more lovely. I would lend you my sword, but I’m looking for someone. Take this. It is a poor substitute, but perhaps it will help you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Farina
recruit-talk.line: Say, excuse me! Yes, you, the grim-faced one!

recruit-talk.speaker: Hector
recruit-talk.line: Me?

recruit-talk.speaker: Farina
recruit-talk.line: You’re really pushing yourself, taking on all these enemies.

recruit-talk.speaker: Hector
recruit-talk.line: It’s not for pleasure! Hey, who are you, anyway!? You’re not with those guys, are you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Farina
recruit-talk.line: Me? No, I’m not. I came out here because I heard I could make some gold. What a joke! Only a fool would work for this piddling amount! Skills like mine do not some cheap.

recruit-talk.speaker: Hector
recruit-talk.line: You seem pretty... sure of yourself.

recruit-talk.speaker: Farina
recruit-talk.line: I am Farina, a mercenary attached to the Strongwings, Ilia’s 3rd division of pegasus knights. No doubt you’ve heard of me!

recruit-talk.speaker: Hector
recruit-talk.line: I’ve heard Ilian mercenaries never betray their employers. So...how much would it cost to hire you for ourselves?

recruit-talk.speaker: Farina
recruit-talk.line: Ah, so you’ve an appreciation for true warriors after all? Let me see... I’m yours for 20,000 gold.

recruit-talk.speaker: Hector
recruit-talk.line: 20,000 gold!?! That’s laughable. No sellsword is worth that much!

recruit-talk.speaker: Farina
recruit-talk.line: I beg to differ. Your journey is a long one, is it not? More than one battle, surely. That requires a special contract, special arrangements. Not to be morbid, but there are sympathy payments to my family in the unlikely event of my death, for example. Not to mention bonuses and hazard pay, medical treatment...

recruit-talk.speaker: Hector
recruit-talk.line: Hold on! That’s enough!! ...Your fee includes all of that, right?

recruit-talk.speaker: Farina
recruit-talk.line: Ah, so you understand? I’m so pleased. Well, what’ll it be? Will you hire me?

recruit-talk.speaker: Hector
recruit-talk.line: What should I do... Hey, Mark! You decide. Should we hire her?

recruit-talk.speaker: Hector
recruit-talk.line: Here it is: 20,000 gold. You’ve no complaints, do you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Farina
recruit-talk.line: Wow!

recruit-talk.speaker: Hector
recruit-talk.line: What is it? You’ll accept it, right?

recruit-talk.speaker: Farina
recruit-talk.line: ...You surprise me. You didn’t even try to negotiate... Just paid the gold up front! Who... Who are you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Hector
recruit-talk.line: I’m Marquess Ostia’s brother, Hector. Are you going to take the money or not?

recruit-talk.speaker: Farina
recruit-talk.line: Ah! My gold!! Of course I’ll take it! Ostia’s the biggest territory in all Lycia, isn’t it? Pleasure doing business with you, noble sir!

recruit-talk.speaker: Hector
recruit-talk.line: Mm. I’m counting on you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Farina
recruit-talk.line: Oh, and there are weapons and vulneraries, too. All of my current possessions are included in my fee. Anything new, you pay for. I never cover those expenses. Never!

recruit-talk.speaker: Hector
recruit-talk.line: You’ve got it all figured out, don’t you?

battle-talk.speaker: Farina
battle-talk.line: Well, if it isn’t Florina!

battle-talk.speaker: Florina
battle-talk.line: Farina... Is it truly you?

battle-talk.speaker: Farina
battle-talk.line: It’s been so long! How have you been?

battle-talk.speaker: Farina
battle-talk.line: Hey! Don’t start crying all over me!!

battle-talk.speaker: Florina
battle-talk.line: ...But... ...Farina... ...I haven’t seen you since you ran away from home.

battle-talk.speaker: Farina
battle-talk.line: Ran away? I didn’t run away.

battle-talk.speaker: Florina
battle-talk.line: But... ...Fiora, she... she said that you weren’t coming home again......

battle-talk.speaker: Farina
battle-talk.line: Well, uh...we... You know, sisters fight sometimes. I said things, she said things... It’s in the past now.

battle-talk.speaker: Florina
battle-talk.line: ...Really?

battle-talk.speaker: Farina
battle-talk.line: Really! Really! Now stop crying, please? So, um... You’re fighting with Lord Hector, too, right? It looks like we’ll be working together for a while.

battle-talk.speaker: Florina
battle-talk.line: ...Uh-huh!

battle-talk.speaker: Farina
battle-talk.line: Ah, Sister?

battle-talk.speaker: Fiora
battle-talk.line: Farina...You...Why are you here?

battle-talk.speaker: Farina
battle-talk.line: You and Florina are with Lord Hector’s company, right?

battle-talk.speaker: Fiora
battle-talk.line: Yes, that’s right. ... You, too?

battle-talk.speaker: Farina
battle-talk.line: Mm. I’m getting paid a nice, hefty sum. I plan to see he gets his money’s worth.

battle-talk.speaker: Fiora
battle-talk.line: Farina... I know it’s been two years, but...

battle-talk.speaker: Farina
battle-talk.line: What? Oh...that. Let’s talk about it later, just the two of us. See you!

battle-talk.speaker: Fiora
battle-talk.line: Oh! Farina... .....

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: That’s it! It’s finished! You’re not nearly good enough to trap us!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: We should have listened to Eliwood. We should’ve gone toward the palace and avoided this trap.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: No sense worrying about it now. What we need to worry about is where we go from here.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Now you try and talk sense? You really are something else, Hector.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Can’t hold a candle to you, though.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Peace! Both of you! Anytime we’re able to weaken our foe, we’ve done well. Now we’ve got to get out of here. No telling when reinforcements might arrive.
